revised_title: Viral Determinants of Influenza Pathogenicity and Epidemicity
tldr: This article discusses the viral determinants of the pathogenicity and epidemicity of influenza, a disease with variable occurrence. The author examines the role of viral antigens, genetic variation, and the impact of population immunity on the course of the disease. The article also highlights the challenges in assessing viral virulence and the importance of understanding these factors for vaccine development and public health strategies.
